text: Hans Sleutelaar (22 September 1935 - 25 June 2020) was a Dutch poet. Together with Cornelis Bastiaan Vaandrager and Hans Verhagen, Sleutelaar was one of the , a Dutch term talking about the literary movement in the 1960s. Together with Eelke de Jong, Sleutelaar collected 500 fairytales in the collection . Among other things, Sleutelaar worked as a junior copywriter at Unilever, as a freelance copywriter, as a Haagse Post employee and as editor-in-chief of publisher Boelen. He had his own publishing company from 1985 to 2000. Sleutelaar died on 25 June 2020 in Rotterdam, aged 84. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Dutch translators Category:Writers from Rotterdam
title: Hans Sleutelaar
